title: Givan resignation triggers fresh NI political crisis
description: The first and deputy first minister can't operate in isolation; when one goes so does the other.

title: Afcon 2021: Egypt beat Cameroon on penalties to set up Senegal final
description: Watch highlights as Egypt edge past hosts Cameroon in a penalty shootout after a goalless draw to set up an Africa Cup of Nations final against Senegal.

title: Australia revisited - a country changed by Covid
description: Nick Bryant returned to Australia to find a more inward and fractured nation than the one he left behind.

title: Soaring prices: 'I may have to move back in with my parents'
description: People from across the UK tell BBC News how they feel about soaring energy bills.

title: Quiz of the week: Record lightning, caterpillar cakes and Spotify row
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: International Space Station to crash down to Earth in 2031
description: Nasa says the ISS will operate until 2030 before the agency hands over to commercial companies.

title: DUP: NI First Minister Paul Givan 'intends to resign'
description: The move is part of the Democratic Unionist Party's protest against the Northern Ireland Protocol.

title: Bafta Film Awards 2022: Dune leads nominations with 11
description: The Power of the Dog, starring Benedict Cumberbatch, got eight nominations, while Belfast got six.

title: Djokovic thanks Serbian president for support amid Covid test doubts
description: Serbian prosecutors have hit back at claims he submitted falsified Covid test certificates.

title: Interest rates rise again in bid to cool soaring prices
description: Bank of England increases rates for the second time in three months as the cost of living rises.

title: Downing Street parties have damaged trust in government - Rishi Sunak
description: But the chancellor dismisses talk of him succeeding Boris Johnson, saying the PM has his "full support".

title: Curry to captain England with Daly, Isiekwe & Simmonds all starting
description: Tom Curry will captain an England side featuring a midfield combination of Henry Slade and Elliot Daly in their Six Nations opener on Saturday.

title: David Goodwillie: Raith Rovers says rapist will not play for them
description: Raith Rovers admits it "got it wrong" by signing David Goodwillie, who was ruled a rapist in a civil case.

title: Gabby Logan's heart screening call for brother Daniel
description: The "catastrophic" impact of losing Daniel when he was 15 is behind the presenter's appeal.

title: Wales give wing Adams first centre start in Six Nations opener
description: Wales give British and Irish Lions wing Josh Adams a first start at centre for the Six Nations opener against Ireland in Dublin.

title: England subside as Australia win first ODI to retain Women's Ashes
description: Australia retain the Women's Ashes as England subside to a 27-run defeat in the first one-day international in Canberra.

title: Winter Olympics: Team GB's Jen Dodds and Bruce Mouat mixed doubles curlers earn notable win against Canada
description: Watch the winning moment as Team GB's mixed doubles curling pair Jen Dodds and Bruce Mouat beat fellow medal hopes Canada at the Winter Olympics in Beijing.

title: Russia says US troops boost in Europe 'destructive'
description: Extra US troops will go to Poland, Romania and Germany amid fears of a Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Woolly mammoth and other Ice Age remains found in Devon
description: The bones, including those of a woolly rhinoceros and wolf, were found on a housing development.

title: Maida Vale deaths: Yasmin Chkaifi was 'clever, kind and witty'
description: The husband of Yasmin Chkaifi, who was stabbed in Maida Vale, says his wife was an "amazing" woman.

title: Winter Olympics: Matt Edmondson and Mollie King go head-to-head in speed skating challenge
description: BBC Radio 1 presenters Mollie King and Matt Edmondson go head-to-head in a speed skating challenge.

title: Encanto: Girl's glasses-wearing Disney heroine wish comes true
description: Lowri wrote to Disney three years ago asking them to create a character with glasses.

title: The Papers: Energy prices 'agony' and council tax cut plans
description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak's plan to ease sharply rising energy bills feature in a number of papers.

title: Spotify boss says too early to know Joe Rogan row impact
description: Shares in the streaming platform fell by more than 10% in after-hours trading.

title: Ukraine crisis: The teenage rock band finding solace in music
description: While troops prepare for a possible Russian invasion on Ukraine’s front line, a teenage rock band in the nearby town of Avdiyivka is finding solace in music.

title: The illegal Brazilian gold you may be wearing
description: A special task force is conducting raids deep in the Amazon to target what it calls "blood gold".

title: The Belfast schoolboy who is mates with Judi Dench
description: Meet Jude Hill, who stars as a young Kenneth Branagh in the director's Oscar-tipped film Belfast.

title: Iris: Student-built robot rover on track to explore the Moon
description: A student-built rover is being prepared for a launch to the Moon later this year.

title: Cost of living: ‘How will we afford anything with bills this high?’
description: A recent poll for BBC 5 Live suggests a third of adults working full-time are struggling to pay their bills.

title: Vaccine trial for killer elephant virus begins
description: Scientists are embarking on the first trial of a vaccine to shield elephants from a deadly disease.

title: How Covid brought new roles for Singapore's theatre actors
description: The production company that found a way to put itself back in the spotlight.

title: Iran accused of sowing Israel discontent with fake Jewish Facebook group
description: A disinformation unit targeted nationalist and ultra-religious Jews on Facebook, researchers say.

title: Beijing 2022: Life inside the Winter Olympics bubble
description: From robot chefs to daily testing - this is what life is like inside the Winter Games bubbles.

title: Russia-Ukraine crisis far from minds in idyllic Vladimir
description: Russians in the ancient town of Vladimir have little time for talk of conflict with their neighbour.

title: 'I have had more time, silence and solitude to write'
description: Why authors like Isabel Allende have moved the traditional book tour online.

title: Africa Cup of Nations: South Africa’s 1996 triumph and its role in post-apartheid change
description: South Africa's 1995 Rugby World Cup win was a huge moment in the country's post-apartheid history. Within a year, there was another.
